alert.note: Alert for Butler (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BUTLER COUNTY THROUGH 815 PM EDT... At 727 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Ross, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Monroe, Trenton, South Middletown, Ross, Seven Mile, Williamsdale, Four Bridges, Wetherington, Olde West Chester, Darrtown, Reily, New Miami, Millville, Hughes, Beckett Ridge, Maustown and Mcgonigle. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 21 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
